metadata.title: Shramik - Setu Samanway
metadata.subtitle: Advancing Labor Welfare and Access for Urban Haryana
metadata.description: A research-driven initiative and digital platform connecting daily wage workers in Sonipat with government welfare schemes and verified employment.

hero_section.headline: Bridging the Gap: Dignity and Security for Every Worker
hero_section.subheadline: Connecting daily wage laborers to better jobs, social security, and government support through the Rozgar Grid.

mission_section.heading: Our Mission
mission_section.content: To turn policies meant for labor welfare into real, visible change. We aim to create a system where every daily wage worker, regardless of skill level, gets fair work, on-time payments, and full access to entitled benefits.

problem_statement.heading: The Challenge: Invisibility and Exclusion
problem_statement.description: Daily wage laborers drive the urban economy in sectors like construction and manufacturing but face uncertain job conditions and inconsistent wages.

key_issues.title: Fragmented Delivery
key_issues.text: Policies exist, but complex registration and low awareness prevent them from reaching the ground level.

key_issues.title: Digital Divide
key_issues.text: Many workers do not know about platforms like e-Shram or how to use them despite owning smartphones.

key_issues.title: Informal Operations
key_issues.text: Contractors often operate informally, leading to wage theft and lack of safety nets.

solution_section.tagline: A vernacular, voice-enabled bridge for worker welfare
solution_section.description: A WhatsApp-based bot that connects laborers directly to verified jobs and eligible government schemes, bypassing complex portals.

features.details: Uses Hinglish prompts and voice notes to overcome literacy barriers.
Dynamically recommends schemes (like PMJAY, BOCW) and assists with claims.
Connects local contractors and MSMEs to verified workers for transparent hiring.
Supported by NGOs and field partners to validate jobs and handle grievances.

testimonials.quote: No one told us about e-Shram, about health insurance—We have cards, but we have no idea how to use them.
testimonials.author: Female Factory Worker

testimonials.quote: The night I lost my husband to a factory accident; I received fifty thousand rupees... How is that compensation for a lost life?
testimonials.author: Widow, Daily Wage Worker

testimonials.quote: New workers often leave just for ₹10 more somewhere else... But my old team has been with me for over 7 years.
testimonials.author: Labour Contractor, Rishihood University Site

stats.label: Awareness Gap
stats.value: Only 3 out of surveyed workers had Ayushman cards; most unaware of usage.

footer.project_team: A student-led initiative under the guidance of Ms. Puja and Shri Jigar Inamdar Sir.
footer.context: Conducted over 8 weeks of fieldwork, policy mapping, and contractor surveys.
footer.contact_cta: Partner with us to transform urban labor welfare.
